body_html: Not sure what the advantage is. I guess this is similar to the use-case that was mentioned earlier, you may have function f(a,b) which modifies variables a,b and you don't want that function to see a,b variable in a partially updated state another copy of f is being executed concurrently
body_text: Not sure what the advantage is. I guess this is similar to the use-case that was mentioned earlier, you may have function f(a,b) which modifies variables a,b and you don't want that function to see a,b variable in a partially updated state another copy of f is being executed concurrently
body: Not sure what the advantage is. I guess this is similar to the use-case that was mentioned earlier, you may have function `f(a,b)` which modifies variables `a`,`b` and you don't want that function to see `a`,`b` variable in a partially updated state another copy of `f` is being executed concurrently
